newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: GOLF-RYDER CUP BECKONS FRONT RUNNER GARRIDO.
newsitem.headline: GOLF-RYDER CUP BECKONS FRONT RUNNER GARRIDO.

text.p: Ryder Cup hopeful Ignacio Garrido battled through another weather-affected day to take a one shot lead over fellow Spaniard Miguel Jimenez after the third round of the Czech Open on Saturday.
The two enjoyed a tremendous tussle but Garrido went ahead with a late eagle as the round ended at dusk.
With fog holding up the completion of the second round for two hours in the morning, the third round only began at the Karlstein course in mid-morning.
Garrido and Jimenez began it one ahead of the field on 11-under-par along with Sweden's Patrik Sjoland.
By the time an electrical storm brought the players in for nearly two hours in late afternoon, Jimenez had nosed in front by the 11th and held his lead until a two-stroke swing came at the long 17th.
While Jimenez could only scramble par, Garrido holed a 20-foot putt for an eagle-two to take himself to the top of the leader board with a six-under 66 for a 16-under 197 total.
Garrido's eagle and four birdies with one dropped stroke put him on the brink of clinching his Ryder Cup place.
He already holds the 10th and final automatic place and will be in the European team for Valderrama comfortably next month if he takes the $211,000 first prize.
It would be his second win of the year following his maiden success seven weeks ago in the German Open.
Jimenez carded 67 for 198, two clear of Australian Stephen Allan and Britain's David Howell.
Sjoland, after challenging for the lead for much of the fragmented day, dropped shots after returning to the course after the storm break and finished a further stroke back.
Bernhard Langeso in the group on 201, seeking his third win of the year with a 64.
